findings.title: Potential unauthorized script upgrade
findings.description: The active smart contract owner has elevated privileges which can lead to potential unauthorized script upgrades.

findings.title: Minting of unlimited number of sundae tokens
findings.description: The contract owner can mint tokens after initial contract creation/deployment.

findings.title: Reentrancy vulnerability in transfer and approve functions
findings.description: The contract contains a reentrancy vulnerability in its transfer and approve functions.

findings.title: Unprotected function calls
findings.description: The functions setBuyBacker, setFees, _setFees, setFeeReceivers, setSwapBackSettings, setTargetLiquidity, and setDistributorSettings are unprotected.

findings.title: Lack of access control in authorize and unauthorize functions
findings.description: The authorize and unauthorize functions lack proper access control, allowing unauthorized users to manipulate the contract's state.

findings.title: Unsecured usage of transferOwnership function
findings.description: The smart contract owner has elevated privileges which can impact the safety and security of the smart contract.

findings.title: Insufficient validation of user input
findings.description: The _initializeFees and _initializeLiquidityBuyBack functions do not properly validate user input, which can lead to potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Unprotected ether reception in receive Ether function
findings.description: The contract does not validate or handle incoming Ether properly, which can lead to unintended behavior.

findings.title: Reentrancy vulnerability in swapBack function
findings.description: The swapBack function contains a reentrancy vulnerability.

findings.title: Unsecured usage of triggerZeusBuyback, clearBuybackMultiplier, setAutoBuybackSettings, and setBuybackMultiplierSettings functions
findings.description: The provided audit report fragments do not explicitly describe this finding. However, based on the function names, it is likely that these functions are used without proper access control or validation, leading to potential security risks.
